a.title: Return to the homepage on the district site.

a.span: Click HERE for Additional Information Regarding the Instructional Continuity Plan
Click HERE for Additional Information Regarding the Instructional Continuity Plan

span.p: This is Steve Dionisio Superintendent of Charlotte County Schools.
I am calling with a message for staff, parents and students.
As we conclude our fourth week of online learning, I want to once again thank all of you for your patience and hard work.
I do have a couple of reminders:
Please continue to use your school and District website as a resource for information and guidance.
In addition, parents and students please continue to reach out to your teachers and school leadership with any questions you might have.
Again thank you in advance for your continued patience and cooperation.
Please stay home and stay safe.

a.span: What is an Instructional Continuity Plan?

span.p: An Instructional Continuity Plan is a plan to continue education in a virtual or alternative setting. The CCPS Instructional Continuity Plan is a tool to ensure our students are provided every opportunity to reinforce and continue their education while at home. Designed to minimize disruption to teaching and learning, the Instructional Continuity Plan will provide flexibility and adaptability for various learners. Please contact your child’s school for more information regarding the Instructional Continuity Plan.

a.title: Go to comments for What is an Instructional Continuity Plan?

a.span: What resources are available to help educate my child at home?

span.p: Visit the Florida Department of Education's Resources for Families.
Check out the CCPS Division of Learning Remote Learning Resources.
Visit floridastudents.org for more resources.

a.span: What are the symptoms of Covid-19 (Coronavirus)

span.p: According to the CDC, the Coronavirus symptoms are:
1. Fever
2. Cough
3. Shortness of Breath
Please see the CDC Website for more information.
